ai-ud1.1:1.2_0: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of the tree of awakening on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.
ai-ud1.1:1.3_0: There the Buddha sat cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ai-ud1.1:1.4_0: When seven days had passed, the Buddha emerged from that state of immersion. In the first part of the night, he reflected on dependent origination in forward and reverse order:
ai-ud1.1:2.1_0: “When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.
ai-ud1.1:2.2_0: Due to the arising of this, that arises is:
ai-ud1.1:2.3_0: ignorance is a condition for choices.
ai-ud1.1:2.4_0: with a (volitional) process as condition: consciousness,
ai-ud1.1:2.5_0: with consciousness as condition: mind and bodily form,
ai-ud1.1:2.6_0: because of mind and body: the six sense spheres,
ai-ud1.1:2.7_0: because of the six sense spheres: contact,
ai-ud1.1:2.13_0: with birth as condition: old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair (all) arise,
ai-ud1.1:2.14_0: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.”
ai-ud1.1:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.1:4.1_0: “When (the nature of) things becomes really manifest
ai-ud1.1:4.4_0: since he understands each thing and its cause.”
